item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.

item.title: Parkrun celebrates million runner milestone - BBC News
item.description:
Parkrun celebrates million runner milestone - BBC News

Parkrun is celebrating a major milestone - more than a million people in the UK have now taken part in the free weekly 5km runs.

item.title: No title
One year since Park Run phenomenon took off
item.description:
One year since Park Run phenomenon took off

EVERY week hundreds of people dressed in T-shirts and trainers head out together, in Tonbridge and Tunbridge Wells, united by one thing - a love for the open air and running. This is parkrun - not a stroll in the park - but more a gentle jog or even a sprint.

item.title: Swim to win
item.description:
Swim to win

First, a confession: my interest in swimming began after I read about Michael Phelps' diet. The decorated Olympic swimmer, I found out, consumes a whopping 12,000 calories a day, involving the chomping down of pizzas, pasta and eight-egg omelettes. If Phelpsy can eat all that and look completely ripped, maybe it's time the rest of us headed to the pool, hey?

item.title: The Best Way To Warm Up
item.description:
The Best Way To Warm Up

Dynamic warm-up drills may be the single best way to prevent injuries and improve performance. As a rule, runners tend to be well-informed when it comes to understanding the best ways to stay healthy and avoid injury. Most runners pay close attention to their diet, monitor their weekly mileage, and replace their running shoes at regular intervals.

item.title: Plantar Fasciitis Has Very Little To Do With Your Foot
item.description:
Plantar Fasciitis Has Very Little To Do With Your Foot

Regardless of what the experts have told you, plantar fasciitis is very rarely about your foot. Like so many other running-related injuries, the reason you are left managing all of the things that go along with plantar fasciitis (PLAN-tur fas-e-I-tis) comes down to the same things.

item.title: How Millennials Ended the Running Boom
item.description:
How Millennials Ended the Running Boom

The running boom is over. Blame millennials. After two decades of furious growth in footrace participants, the number of finishers dropped 9% in 2015, according to industry-funded research group Running USA.

item.title: Swim Like A Triathlete, Not A Swimmer - Triathlete Europe
item.description:
Swim Like A Triathlete, Not A Swimmer - Triathlete Europe

By Sara McLarty Published October 29, 2015 You're not a single-sport pool swimmer, so why would you train like one? Whenever freestyle swimming technique is discussed, names of fast and famous pool swimmers are tossed about: Michael Phelps, Ryan Lochte, Katie Ledecky and Sun Yang, to name a few.

item.title: Who cares if you run slow? - Triathlete Europe
item.description:
Who cares if you run slow? - Triathlete Europe

By Jeff Gaudette Published 2 days ago When I first started working with age group and recreational runners in 2006, one of the biggest surprises to me was the amount of negative thinking and lack of self-confidence many runners exhibited.
